body:
Please tell me how to reproduce this problem, I tried "Delete all repositories' archives (ZIP, TAR.GZ, etc...)" . There is no problem as you said.
![image](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/assets/50507092/39b90f4f-7867-43c5-a20d-4d69f6254255)

I did exact the same step but I got the issue.
I don't know yet how to reproduce the problem.
There are no error messages in the logs.
What's your `app.ini`? Especially the storage path related options.

Here is all the parts of the app.ini file, which have a path.
```
WORK_PATH = /data/gitea
[repository]
ROOT = /data/git/repositories
[repository.local]
LOCAL_COPY_PATH = /data/gitea/tmp/local-repo

[repository.upload]
TEMP_PATH = /data/gitea/uploads

[server]
APP_DATA_PATH = /data/gitea

[storage]
STORAGE_TYPE = local
PATH = /data/git

[indexer]
ISSUE_INDEXER_PATH = /data/gitea/indexers/issues.bleve

[session]
PROVIDER_CONFIG = /data/gitea/sessions
PROVIDER = file

[picture]
AVATAR_UPLOAD_PATH = /data/gitea/avatars
REPOSITORY_AVATAR_UPLOAD_PATH = /data/gitea/repo-avatars

[attachment]
PATH = /data/gitea/attachments

[log]
ROOT_PATH = /data/gitea/log
MODE = file
```
Would that help?

The problem is 

```
[storage]
STORAGE_TYPE = local
PATH = /data/git
```

The INI package has a quirk behavior: the path is inherited, so `storage.repo-archive` also uses path `/data/git`

Then everything is removed under the `/data/git`

Related to : Fix all possible setting error related storages and added some tests (#23911)

@lunny

issue.title: Fix all possible setting error related storages and added some tests

issue.body:
Follow up #22405

Fix #20703 

This PR rewrites storage configuration read sequences with some breaks and tests. It becomes more strict than before and also fixed some inherit problems.

- Move storage's MinioConfig struct into setting, so after the configuration loading, the values will be stored into the struct but not still on some section.
- Add more tests for storages configurations.
- Update the storage documentations.

The break changes

- All storages configurations should be stored in one section, configuration items cannot be overrided by multiple  sections now. The priority of configuration is `[attachment]` > `[storage.attachments]` |  `[storage.customized]` > `[storage]` > `default`
- For extra override configuration items, currently are `SERVE_DIRECT`, `MINIO_BASE_PATH`, `MINIO_BUCKET`, which could be configured in another section. The prioioty of the override configuration is `[attachment]` > `[storage.attachments]` > `default`.

i.e. This is a previous supported configuration
```ini
[storage]
STOTRAGE_TYPE = minio
MINIO_LOCATION = euro
MINIO_USE_SSL = false

[storage.lfs]
MINIO_BUCKET = my_bucket

[lfs]
MINIO_BASE_PATH = lfs/
```

Now it will not be supported. Only one section can be derived. You need to change it like below.
```ini
[storage]
STOTRAGE_TYPE = minio
MINIO_LOCATION = euro
MINIO_USE_SSL = false

[storage.lfs]
MINIO_BUCKET = my_bucket
MINIO_BASE_PATH = lfs/

[lfs]
```

or 

```ini
[storage]
STOTRAGE_TYPE = minio
MINIO_LOCATION = euro
MINIO_USE_SSL = false

[lfs]
MINIO_BUCKET = my_bucket
MINIO_BASE_PATH = lfs/
```

And below will not be allowed because `MINIO_USE_SSL` cannot be as a derived item. Only `SERVE_DIRECT`, `MINIO_BASE_PATH`, `MINIO_BUCKET` can be derived items.

```ini
[storage]
STOTRAGE_TYPE = minio
MINIO_LOCATION = euro

[lfs]
MINIO_USE_SSL = false
MINIO_BUCKET = my_bucket
MINIO_BASE_PATH = lfs/
```

issue.body:
This PR will fix #26264, caused by #23911.

The package configuration derive is totally wrong when storage type is local in that PR.

This PR fixed the inherit logic when storage type is local with some unit tests.

The breakage is if storage type is `local`, the end derive section will derive it but not just use it directly. i.e.

```ini
[storage]
STORAGE_TYPE = local
PATH = /data
```
Then the attachments storage directory will be `/data/attachments` but not `/data`, the behavior is different from before.

issue.title: Fix the wrong derive path (#26271)

issue.body:
I propose reverting https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/pull/26318 in 1.20 and implementing this PR as-is, and also frontporting this enhancement for future versions.

#26318 would need to be reverted, otherwise the derivation would be "fixed" and this PR wouldn't have the intended effect.

This PR aims to help mitigate the bug being fixed by #26318 in a way that doesn't lead to silent data loss for existing users affected, while also being a valuable sanity check in the future.

/cc @go-gitea/technical-oversight-committee

Also /cc @earl-warren for the initial idea implemented here

-----

## For anyone directed here because of the log message

You'll want to follow the message and explicitly set your storage paths. Be aware that this will mean Gitea looks in new paths, so for any data that still lives in the old path, you will need to move it to the correct spot, such as repositories, LFS, attachments, etc.

Feel free to stop by any of our [support avenues](https://docs.gitea.com/help/support) if you need further assistance.
